mainEntity.name: WHO IS ELIGIBLE?

acceptedAnswer.text: Your client may be eligible if they have a current Medicaid Insurance ID and are going to a Medicaid-approved appointment.

mainEntity.name: HOW DO THEY SCHEDULE A RIDE?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please schedule at least 24 hours in advance by calling {{OFFICE_PHONE}} between 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM, Monday-Friday. After hours, call dispatch at {{DISPATCH_PHONE}}.

mainEntity.name: HOW DO THEY CANCEL A RIDE?

acceptedAnswer.text: Call at least two hours before your pick-up time at {{OFFICE_PHONE}}. After hours, call dispatch at {{DISPATCH_PHONE}}.

mainEntity.name: WHICH SERVICES ARE COVERED?

acceptedAnswer.text: Transportation is provided for Medicaid-covered services. We cannot transport to services not covered by Medicaid.

mainEntity.name: HOW DOES THE CLIENT GET APPROVED?

acceptedAnswer.text:
An attending Physician/PA/NP/Therapist or other licensed professional must complete and sign the Medical Certificate of Transportation Services.

If the client lives beyond 25 miles from the provider, the additional 25-mile form is also required. See our Medical Certificate of Transportation Services form.

mainEntity.name: WHEN SHOULD THEY BE READY FOR THEIR RIDE?

acceptedAnswer.text: We'll give you a readiness timeframe when you schedule. Shared rides may require being ready earlier. Traffic/weather may cause delays.

mainEntity.name: What insurance do you take?

acceptedAnswer.text:
We currently accept:

  • Aetna
  • Blue Cross Blue Shield (Anthem)
  • Cigna
  • Health First Colorado (Medicaid)
  • Humana
  • Medicare
  • United Healthcare

mainEntity.name: What does my insurance cover?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please contact your insurer to confirm whether your requested item is covered.

mainEntity.name: What do I have to fill out to request DME or supplies?

acceptedAnswer.text: First verify coverage with your insurer. Then your prescriber gathers medical-necessity documentation for our DME Specialists. Orders can't be completed without everything listed under “What We Need for Orders.”

mainEntity.name: What is Medicare's definition of DME?

acceptedAnswer.text:
• Durable (withstands repeated use)
  • Appropriate for use in the home
  • Primarily for a medical purpose
  • Necessary and reasonable for treatment

mainEntity.name: Does Golden Gate Medical Supplies do repairs?

acceptedAnswer.text: We don't specialize in repairs, but may do simple fixes (e.g., brakes, wheels, accessories). Repairs are at the patient's discretion through a certified service.

mainEntity.name: Am I able to get DME and/or supplies out of pocket?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. You can purchase out of pocket without a prescriber, though we recommend consulting your doctor. Ask about rent-to-own options.

mainEntity.name: What services are included in assisted living?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Services include:

  • Daily care assistance (hygiene, dressing, mobility)
  • Three meals and snacks
  • Transportation to medical appointments
  • Medication management
  • Light housekeeping and laundry
  • Scheduling/coordination of appointments
  • Recreational activities and amenities

See our Assisted Living page or contact us for the full list.

mainEntity.name: How do I know if assisted living is for me or my loved one?

acceptedAnswer.text: It may be right if you need help with daily activities, want independence with support, would benefit from community, need help with meals/housekeeping/transportation, prefer 24-hour staff availability, and don't require full nursing care. Schedule a consultation and tour.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of assisted living at Golden Gate Manor?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Without insurance, costs depend on income plus fees—contact us for a personalized quote.

With Medicaid, the out-of-pocket expense is $797, with remaining covered amounts varying. Spending allowances can change; contact us to discuss details.

mainEntity.name: How is assisted living different from nursing homes?

acceptedAnswer.text: Assisted living supports independence with help for daily activities (often private/semi-private rooms). Nursing homes provide 24-hour skilled nursing and more intensive medical care.

mainEntity.name: Is there 24-hour staff available?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. Staff are on-site 24/7 for emergencies and support.

mainEntity.name: Can I schedule a tour of the facility?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes—call 719-696-8032 or contact us via the website to schedule a tour.

mainEntity.name: What types of fuel do you offer?

acceptedAnswer.text: Regular (87), mid-grade (89), premium (93) unleaded fuels, plus diesel. Conoco TOP TIER™ additives; pumps inspected and maintained.

mainEntity.name: Do you accept credit cards and EBT/SNAP?

acceptedAnswer.text: We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, cash, fleet cards, and commercial accounts. EBT/SNAP is planned for the future.

mainEntity.name: What convenience store items do you carry?

acceptedAnswer.text: Snacks, candy, slushies, F'Real shakes/smoothies, cold beer, sodas and energy drinks, chips, jerky, refrigerated grab-and-go items, basic household goods, phone chargers, and travel essentials.

mainEntity.name: Do you have an ATM on-site?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes—available during store hours with a $2.50 fee. Dispenses $20s and supports balance inquiries/mini-statements.

mainEntity.name: Do you carry automotive supplies (oil, windshield fluid, etc.)?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes—motor oil, washer fluid, antifreeze, brake fluid, gas cans, basic tools, jumper cables, tire gauges, air fresheners, and emergency road kits.

mainEntity.name: Do you sell lottery tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes—scratch tickets ($1-$30) and draw games (Powerball, Mega Millions, Colorado Lotto+, Cash 5, Pick 3). We cash winnings up to $500.
